title: A Hear For All Seasons Episode 1 [eng]

Audio:
For our primary viewing session, we listened to this disc in its original language of Japanese. Though a fairly recent show, it doesnÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½t get beyond a serviceable stereo track. Dialogue is clear and distortion free, and we noticed no dropouts or other issues on either track. Video:
Overall, this is a really nice looking transfer. While it doesnÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½t have the overly CG feel of some of the most recent shows, itÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s definitely a smooth looking show that features some good animation and color design. As such, thereÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s little trouble here beyond some background blues, such as the night sky or the water, shifting around a bit. Packaging:
Showcasing its best attributes, the front cover is a bright and shiny piece that has the various women f the series in various outfits. ItÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s very colorful and looks great, definitely an eye-catching piece of work. The back cover keeps the light feel with the slightly cloudy sky background and the bright colors all over it. Content: (please note that content portions of a review may contain spoilers)
Heat for All Seasons is a show that takes its cues from its title, as each of the three OVAÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s in the show correspond to a different season, to some extent. Actually, itÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s all very loosely held together by that theme, but hey, it shows some creativity.

The show is featured around Masato, a somewhat shy and introverted (dub: college) (sub: high school) student. Masato and his friend Oka have both recently started working during the summer at a local restaurant in Namiekaze City. This brings up the usual restaurant kind of hijinks, where we have Oka going after the very attractive waitress named Chieri. HeÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s the strong confident one, so he knows right off that he wants to and will score with her.

Masato on the other hand ends up having a very different and much more complicated situation. While heÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s outside sweeping one day, a woman named Chihiro comes up to him and tries to figure out where she knows him. After a brief exchange, the two realize that they went to junior high school together, up until Masato moved away suddenly from Tokyo to Namiekaze, due to his fathersÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ job. Masato canÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½t get over how hot she is, but gets deflated when what appears to be her boyfriend shows up. Even the manager canÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½t help but thwart him, by telling him that the boy is the rich son of a local politician.

Circumstances lead to an encounter a few days later where Masato gets to take advantage of a situation, though pushed ahead by Oka, where he spends an evening outside catching up with Chihiro. The two become close rather quickly, and things lead where one would expect. ItÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s the first time for both of them, so itÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s done awkwardly but still well enough. Well, depending on what language youÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½re listening to it in.

Having listened to the dub while having the subtitles on, you can easily tell how ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½spiced upÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ the English dub is, with lots more swearing and bluntness. While that may appeal to some, itÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ll make you wonder why I found the story to be somewhat tender and more couples friendly or a good introduction to hentai. The subtitled version is much more romantic at times and less coarse.

One of the more amusing segments to these episodes is MasatoÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s imagination. He constantly visualizes himself with various women he meets (only to really get with them later), but the situations are presented in an interesting way. While theyÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½re done with a black background and just the focus on the people, the situations almost seem to be tender as opposed to the slam bam thank you maÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½am kind youÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½d guess would go through most mens minds. These daydreams also lead to some amusing moments in his interaction with other people.

The show goes in various directions through the three episodes, though with Masato and ChihiroÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s relationship at the center. Both end up becoming involved at various levels with other people, but itÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s mostly Masato and Oka getting around. Amusingly, Oka does get to score with Chieri but it comes back to haunt him. SheÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s something of a nymphomaniac and wants constant sex from him, to the point where heÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s no longer interested in sex at all.

Heat for All Seasons features a lot of very attractive character designs, good encounters between the characters and a pretty simple first-loves going wrong kind of plot that makes up your basic romance novel material. ItÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s not as funny as Welcome to Pia Carrot, but there are plenty of similarities. After all, it features a line that when Masato is dreaming of Chihiro and looks between her legs, he goes, ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½IÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ve never seen this without a mosaic before.ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ Definitely a good single disc recommendation, especially when you consider that it was previously released dub only on three tapes for $25 each.
